articles.headline: Could Wages and Prices Spiral Upward in America?
articles.snippet: A labor shortage that began as businesses reopened from pandemic lockdowns is helping to push up pay. The Fed is watching carefully.
articles.abstract: A labor shortage that began as businesses reopened from pandemic lockdowns is helping to push up pay. The Fed is watching carefully.
articles.lead_paragraph: Amazon, Bank of America and Chipotle are among a spate of companies raising wages this year as they compete for workers in a labor market with more open positions than unemployed job seekers.

articles.headline: Artillery Exchanges in Eastern Ukraine May Presage Invasion, U.S. Warns
articles.snippet: As shelling intensified in the east, officials warned that Moscow might use false claims of “genocide” against Russians in the region as a pretext for an attack.
articles.abstract: As shelling intensified in the east, officials warned that Moscow might use false claims of “genocide” against Russians in the region as a pretext for an attack.
articles.lead_paragraph: STANYTSIA LUHANSKA, Ukraine — Residents near Ukraine’s front line rushed into basements for cover Thursday as exchanges of artillery fire with Russian-backed separatists reached their most intense level in months, an ominous development amid Western fears that Russia might use the fighting as a pretext to invade Ukraine.
articles.byline: By Andrew E. Kramer and Anton Troianovski

articles.headline: The United States’ Message to Russia: Prove Us Wrong
articles.snippet: “If Russia doesn’t invade Ukraine, then we will be relieved that Russia changed course,’’ Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken said at the United Nations.
articles.abstract: “If Russia doesn’t invade Ukraine, then we will be relieved that Russia changed course,’’ Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken said at the United Nations.
articles.lead_paragraph: MUNICH — President Biden and his top aides acknowledge they are risking American credibility as they constantly renew the alarm that Russia is only “several days” away from triggering an unprovoked land war in Europe that could kill tens of thousands of Ukrainians in its opening hours, and plunge the world back into something resembling the Cold War.

articles.headline: In Nashville, a Gerrymander Goes Beyond Politics to the City’s Core
articles.snippet: Tennessee was long known for a brand of moderate Southern politics. Nashville, a blue island in a red state, is finding that the old rules no longer apply.
articles.abstract: Tennessee was long known for a brand of moderate Southern politics. Nashville, a blue island in a red state, is finding that the old rules no longer apply.
articles.lead_paragraph: NASHVILLE — Not since Patsy Cline made it a country standard in 1961, perhaps, has “I Fall to Pieces” resonated so poignantly in Music City.

articles.headline: These Vaccines Have Been Embraced by the World. Why Not in China?
articles.snippet: Beijing once said it had two mRNA shots within reach and ready for approval — one homemade and one produced by a foreign company. Today, neither is available.
articles.abstract: Beijing once said it had two mRNA shots within reach and ready for approval — one homemade and one produced by a foreign company. Today, neither is available.
articles.lead_paragraph: China has done everything in its power to keep the virus outside its borders and protect its people — almost.

articles.headline: Bots and Fake Accounts Push China’s Vision of Winter Olympic Wonderland
articles.snippet: The country’s propagandists have used a variety of tools online to promote a vision of the Games that is free of rancor or controversy.
articles.abstract: The country’s propagandists have used a variety of tools online to promote a vision of the Games that is free of rancor or controversy.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article is published with ProPublica, the nonprofit investigative newsroom.
articles.byline: By Steven Lee Myers, Paul Mozur and Jeff Kao

articles.headline: Vladimir Putin: Crafty Strategist or Aggrieved and Reckless Leader?
articles.snippet: Analysts puzzling over the Russian leader’s intentions say that his troop buildup around Ukraine could be a convincing bluff, but also posit that he could have fundamentally changed during the pandemic.
articles.abstract: Analysts puzzling over the Russian leader’s intentions say that his troop buildup around Ukraine could be a convincing bluff, but also posit that he could have fundamentally changed during the pandemic.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — At this moment of crescendo for the Ukraine crisis, it all comes down to what kind of leader President Vladimir V. Putin is.
